Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites

  • Jump to recipe

Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites — Step into a world of crispy, flavorful delight with our Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites recipe!

These bite-sized treats offer all the savory goodness of a classic blooming onion. But in a convenient, snackable form.

Save This Recipe Form

Want to save this recipe?

Enter your email below & I will send it straight to your inbox. Plus you’ll get more great recipes from me on occasion!

Using the air fryer, we achieve that perfect golden crispiness without deep frying, Which makes this a healthier option that doesn’t compromise taste.

Ideal for appetizers, party snacks, or a fun family cooking project. These blooming onion bites are delicious and a breeze to make. Stay tuned for the recipe and prepare to wow your taste buds and guests!

What Are Blooming Onion Bites

Blooming Onion Bites are a miniature, snackable version of the popular appetizer– the blooming onion.

Traditionally, a blooming onion involves cutting a whole onion into a flower-like shape, battering it, and deep-frying it until crispy. With Blooming Onion Bites, this concept is adapted into smaller, bite-sized pieces, making them easier to prepare and consume.

Wither air-fried plain or coated in a seasoned batter and then air-fried to achieve a crispy exterior with a tender and sweet onion interior. These bites offer the same tantalizing flavors and textures as the larger version but in a more convenient and often healthier form due to using an air fryer instead of deep frying.

Why You Will Love This Recipe!

You’ll love this Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites recipe for several reasons:

  • Healthier Alternative: Air frying offers the crispy deliciousness of blooming onions. But, with much less oil than deep frying, making it a healthier choice.
  • Easy to Make: This recipe simplifies the classic dish into bite-sized pieces that are easier to prepare and cook, perfect for any home cook.
  • Perfect Snack Size: Their bite-size nature makes them a great snack or appetizer. Ideal for sharing at gatherings or enjoying a tasty treat.
  • Flavorful and Crispy: You get all the savory and crunchy goodness of a blooming onion in a convenient, finger-food form.
  • Versatile: Serve them with your choice of dips and seasonings to suit any palate.

Ingredients Needed For Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites

Get ready to create a delicious snack that will impress with our Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites recipe.

These ingredients are carefully chosen to deliver the perfect combination of crispiness and flavor, making it easy to enjoy a favorite appetizer in a new, healthier way. Here’s what you’ll need to bring this tasty treat to life in your kitchen.

Remember the step-by-step directions and detailed ingredient list are below, in the printable recipe card at the bottom of the post, as well as the nutritional information.

  • Frozen Pearl Onions: Serve as the base for the bites, offering a sweet and mild flavor, and their small size is perfect for bite-sized snacks.
  • Olive Oil: Helps to crisp up the onion bites in the air fryer and adds a subtle richness to their flavor.
  • Paprika: Provides a mild, sweet, and smoky flavor, enhancing the overall taste of the onion bites.
  • Oregano: Adds a hint of earthy, slightly bitter, and aromatic flavor, complementing the sweetness of the onions.
  • Ground Thyme and Cumin: These spices offer a warm, earthy taste with a touch of citrus and pine, adding complexity to the seasoning.
  • Salt and Pepper: Essential for seasoning, they balance and enhance the natural flavors of the onions and spices.

Each ingredient creates a flavorful and enjoyable snack, transforming simple pearl onions into a delightful and crispy treat in your air fryer.

How To Make Blooming Onion Bites In Air Fryer

To cook Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites with the listed ingredients, follow these steps:

Mix the Seasonings: In a large bowl, combine olive oil, paprika, oregano, ground thyme, cumin, salt, and pepper.

Add Onions: Take the frozen pearl onions (do not defrost) and add them to the bowl. Toss them gently to ensure they are evenly coated with the seasoning mix.

Air Fry: Preheat your air fryer. Place the seasoned onions in the air fryer basket, set the air fryer temperature to 400 degrees F, and set cook time for 10-15 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Shake the basket halfway through for even cooking.

Serve: Once cooked, let them cool slightly before serving. These onion bites are perfect as a snack or appetizer, served with your favorite dipping sauce.

Recipe Variations

Exploring different variations of Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites can add excitement and diversity to this tasty appetizer:

  • Different Seasonings: Experiment with various spices like garlic powder, onion powder, or a Cajun spice mix for different flavor profiles.
  • Cheese Topping: After air frying, sprinkle some grated Parmesan or cheddar cheese on the onion bites for a cheesy flavor.
  • Dipping Sauces: Serve with dipping sauces like ranch, honey mustard, or spicy mayo to cater to different tastes.

These variations offer new ways to enjoy the crispy and flavorful Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites, making them adaptable for any occasion or preference.

Pro Tips

Here are some pro tips for making Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites:

  • Even Coating: Ensure the onions are evenly coated with the seasoning and oil for consistent flavor and crispiness.
  • Do Not Overcrowd: Cook in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding in the air fryer basket, allowing for even air circulation and crispiness.
  • Shake the Basket: Halfway through cooking, shake the air fryer basket to ensure even cooking and browning of the onion bites.
  • Watch the Time: Keep an eye on the cooking time, as smaller onion pieces may cook faster, and you don’t want them to burn.

Faq’s

Can I use fresh onions instead of frozen pearl onions? You can use fresh onions, but they must be cut into small pieces. The cooking time may vary slightly.

Are these bites spicy? The basic recipe isn’t very spicy, but you can add more spices, like cayenne pepper to adjust the heat.

Can I make these ahead of time? They are best served fresh, but you can prepare the onions and seasoning mix beforehand. Cook them in the air fryer just before serving.

What’s the best way to reheat leftovers? Reheat in the air fryer for a few minutes to retain the crispiness.

Are these suitable for a gluten-free diet? These onion bites are naturally gluten-free as long as no gluten-containing ingredients are used.

Don’t Forget To Pin!

Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites

3.93 from 14 votes
Author: Fork To Spoon
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins
Cook Time: 15 minutes mins
Total Time: 20 minutes mins
Servings: 6 Servings
Print

Description

Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites — Step into a world of crispy, flavorful delight with our Air Fryer Blooming Onion Bites recipe!

Ingredients 

  • 12 ounces pearl onions , frozen
  • 2 tablespoon olive oil
  • ½ teaspoon paprika
  • ½ teaspoon oregano
  • ½ teaspoon ground thyme
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon kosher salt
  • ½ teaspoon black pepper

Instructions

  • Mix the Seasonings: In a large bowl, combine olive oil, paprika, oregano, ground thyme, cumin, salt, and pepper.
  • Add Onions: Take the frozen pearl onions (do not defrost) and add them to the bowl. Toss them gently to ensure they are evenly coated with the seasoning mix.
  • Air Fry: Preheat your air fryer. Place the seasoned onions in the air fryer basket and cook at a high temperature (around 400°F or 200°C) for about 10-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy. Shake the basket halfway through for even cooking.
  • Serve: Once cooked, let them cool slightly before serving. These onion bites are perfect as a snack or appetizer, served with your favorite dipping sauce.

Equipment

  • Air Fryer
  • Cooking Spray
  • Parchment Paper, optional

Nutrition

Serving: 1ServingCalories: 66kcalCarbohydrates: 6gProtein: 1gFat: 5gSaturated Fat: 1gPolyunsaturated Fat: 1gMonounsaturated Fat: 3gSodium: 197mgPotassium: 92mgFiber: 1gSugar: 2gVitamin A: 23IUVitamin C: 5mgCalcium: 20mgIron: 0.4mg
